definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)

sentences.english: There was so much noise outside that we couldn't hear the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 外面噌杂声很大，以致我们不能听到老师的话。

sentences.english: Retain the head of the shrimp after removing as a flavouring for miso soup and other dishes.
sentences.chinese: 列下的虾头可用来煮味噌汤，不要丢掉。

sentences.english: His favorite meals were fried shrimp and Japanese miso soup with clams, the statement said.
sentences.chinese: 他最喜欢吃的饭是炸大虾和日本的味噌汤，声明说。

sentences.english: Add miso to soups or salad dressings, or use it to marinate vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 味噌能添加到汤或沙拉酱里面，或者用它来腌蔬菜。

sentences.english: Can I have another bowl of that miso soup?
sentences.chinese: 我可以再喝一碗味噌汤吗？

sentences.english: I listened until the jingle of their spurs faded.
sentences.chinese: 马刺的“噌噌”声也随着他们的远去而渐渐消失。

sentences.english: I listened until the jingle of their spurs faded.
sentences.chinese: 马刺的“噌噌”声也随着他们的远去而渐渐消失。

sentences.english: The sparrow whizzed up into a tree.
It's my turn. I want some barbecued eel and a bowl of miso soup.
sentences.chinese: 轮到我了，我要一些烤鳗鱼和一碗味噌汤。

sentences.english: Mr. Dursely jumped to his feet, veins throbbing in his temples.
sentences.chinese: 达斯力先生噌一下站起来，气得太阳穴的血管直跳。

definition: with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
(onom.) giggling/breathing/tearing of paper, ripping of fabric etc
